title: Domain Similarity-Perceived Label Assignment for Domain Generalized Underwater Object Detection. (arXiv:2401.05401v1 [cs.CV])
abstract: The inherent characteristics and light fluctuations of water bodies give rise to the huge difference between different layers and regions in underwater environments. When the test set is collected in a different marine area from the training set, the issue of domain shift emerges, significantly compromising the model's ability to generalize. The Domain Adversarial Learning (DAL) training strategy has been previously utilized to tackle such challenges. translated_title: 领域相似性感知标签分配用于领域通用水下物体检测
translated_abstract: 水体的固有特性和光波动引起了水下环境中不同层次和区域之间的巨大差异。当测试集在与训练集不同的海洋区域收集时，领域转移问题出现，严重影响了模型的泛化能力。领域对抗学习（DAL）训练策略之前被用于解决这些挑战。然而，DAL严重依赖于手动进行独热编码的领域标签，这意味着同一领域样本之间没有差异。这种假设导致了DAL的不稳定性。本文引入了领域相似性感知标签分配（DSP）的概念。每张图片的领域标签被看作其与指定领域的相似性。通过领域特定的数据增强技术，在水下跨领域物体检测基准S-UODAC2020上取得了最先进的结果。
tldr: 该论文介绍了领域相似性感知标签分配（DSP）的概念，通过将每个图像的领域标签视为其与指定领域的相似性，使用领域特定的数据增强技术，在水下跨领域物体检测基准S-UODAC2020上达到了最先进的结果。
en_tdlr: This paper introduces the concept of Domain Similarity-Perceived Label Assignment (DSP), where the domain label for each image is regarded as its similarity to the specified domains. By using domain-specific data augmentation techniques, state-of-the-art results on the underwater cross-domain object detection benchmark S-UODAC2020 were achieved.
